headline.main: ASK LONGER MORATORIUM.; Uruguayan Business Men Urge Senate to Extend Time on Debts.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 21.--Argentina and Brazil are preparing for a bilateral economic conference along the lines of the tripartite negotiations now in progress here. The Brazilian delegation at Montevideo has been instructed to proceed to Buenos Aires...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 21.--Argentina and Brazil are preparing for a bilateral economic conference along the lines of the tripartite negotiations now in progress here. The Brazilian delegation at Montevideo has been instructed to proceed to Buenos Aires immediately at the termination of the present conference.
docs.abstract: Brazilian delegates will go to Buenos Aires; resumption of conf depends on Argentinians

headline.main: BRAZIL SEEKS PACT ON ARGENTINE TRADE; Delegation to Go to Buenos Aires When Present Conference in Montevideo Closes.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: LATIN PARLEY MARKS TIME.; Delegates at Montevideo Await Return of Argentines.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 23.--The Argentine delegation to the tripartite economic conference here have telegraphed from Buenos Aires a request that the sessions be postponed until Monday, when they plan to return to Montevideo.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 23.--The Argentine delegation to the tripartite economic conference here have telegraphed from Buenos Aires a request that the sessions be postponed until Monday, when they plan to return to Montevideo.
docs.abstract: Argentines telegraph postponement; Brazil and Uruguay make progress on bilateral accord

headline.main: ARGENTINES POSTPONE LATIN PARLEY AGAIA; Brazilians and Uruguayans of Montevideo, However, Progress on Bilateral Accord. Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES.

headline.main: SPAIN RAISES DUTIES TO PROHIBITIVE LEVEL; Automobiles and Telephone Equipment on New List-- Treaties to Be Revised. BELGIUM PREPARES TO ACT Premier to Invoke His Powers to Increase Tariff Rates and Regulate Imports. Spain to Revise Trade Pacts. headline.main: KAHN'S WORDS CITED IN URGING A DFFAULT; Uruguayan Paper Says Banker Showed Sacrifices to Pay Debts Are Futile.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 25.--The Senate has passed a bill extending the moratorium on foreign commercial debts until the end of next December, with monthly payments extended throughout the year.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Dec. 25.--The Senate has passed a bill extending the moratorium on foreign commercial debts until the end of next December, with monthly payments extended throughout the year.

headline.main: URUGUAY ADVANCES NEW MORATORIUM; Senate Votes Extension of Delay on Foreign Business Obligations for a Year. QUOTA PUT ON DIVIDENDS Power of Central Bank Increased, Alarming Industry--Plan for Oil Development Approved. Bank's Power Increased. Oil Survey Approved.
